WHAT WE DO

We take your congregation's web presence and we force it back into the look and feel of a 1987 church bulletin board. Three spiritually approved fonts. A grease-stained napkin background. A scrolling prayer marquee that takes five seconds per cycle because some things should not be rushed.

GARY'S TESTIMONY

"I built this the night I found my Aunt Darlene's Harvest Festival flyer in her attic. I sat on the floor crying because that smudged mimeograph paper with its crooked clip art cross felt more like church than anything SpireConnect has ever sold for $49.99 a month."

"I miss when community was inconvenient. When you had to squint to read the potluck schedule. When you had to call Evelyn directly to get the pineapple cake recipe because the ink bled through. That friction was the point. It meant you had to talk to each other."

- Gary Loomis, Kearney NE, 2:47 AM, March 2014

FEATURES

The Bulletin Builder

Our icon library includes a cross that pixelates above 72dpi, a dove with visible ink bleeds, and a casserole dish we're 60% sure is a casserole dish. Every icon was hand-scanned from a 1986 Epson printout found in a Goodwill box in Lincoln.

Image Filters

The Custodian's Closet

Our admin panel. Password recovery requires answering: "What was the exact measurement of flour in Pastor Jim's disastrous '87 Easter bread fiasco?" If you get it wrong, you wait 24 hours for Gary to manually email you a reset. This is a feature.

All features are spiritually approved and legally distinct from SpireConnect®

A PRAYER FOR THE INTERNET

"Lord, we ask that You look upon this internet and see what we have done with it. We took a miracle and we made it into a vending machine. We took the gift of speaking to anyone on earth and we used it to sell each other things we do not need. We took the churches You built with hands and hymnals and we turned them into subscription services with dropdown menus and customer support tickets. Forgive us for making community convenient. Forgive us for the frictionless experience. Forgive us for every autoplaying video and every chat widget that asks 'How can I help you today?' when nobody on the other end is real. We pray for the bulletin boards, Lord. For the smudged ink and the crooked clip art. For the women who typed the newsletters and the men who folded them wrong. For the coffee that was always burnt and the fellowship that was always real. Amen."

This prayer was composed on a Tandy 1000 in 1987. It has not been updated because it did not need to be.

Evelyn's Pineapple Upside-Down Cake

2 cans pineapple rings (save the juice)
1/2 cup butter
1 cup brown sugar
Maraschino cherries
1 box yellow cake mix
Follow the box but use the pineapple juice instead of water
Bake at 350° 45 min
Flip it while it's hot or don't bother
- E.
